body: @dhalperi @kennknowles I pushed a commit of everything but the name until we decide. I still think `of` is the most API consistent name.
Also a `default` method has a new meaning in Java 8. Default methods were added to Java 8 primarily to support lambda expressions.

LGTM

A good point of comparison is to look at Hamcrest [`Matchers`](http://static.javadoc.io/org.hamcrest/hamcrest-all/1.3/org/hamcrest/Matchers.html). Most of those return `Matcher<T>` rather than some specific matcher. A few, which have extra functions (like `AnyOf`) return a more specific (but still abstract) class.
Beautiful, thanks! We can continue discussions of new functions, but importantly we have the name you want in the final class in the 0.5.0 release.

https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-1339 :-)
Yea this should be tagged with [BEAM-65](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-65).

> What JIRA is this under?

@jkff I filed [BEAM-1340](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-1340) which you should tag this with for sure, and also take your pick from [BEAM-65](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-65) or in the same spirit all of [BEAM-1035](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-1035), [BEAM-1036](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-1036), [BEAM-1037](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-1037), [BEAM-1113](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-1113), [BEAM-1114](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-1114), [BEAM-1115](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-1115), [BEAM-1116](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-1116), [BEAM-1116](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-1116) :metal:

> What's the rationale for this change?

Incidentally, this PR would also be a good idea even if the removed methods were private or package-private (so BEAM-1340 would not apply) and even if it did not help any particular ongoing effort. I would like to be sure to never discourage code health improvements, regardless of whether they have a simple narrative. So perhaps file a blanket JIRA for it or encourage such changes to be tagged [#codehealth] in their subject.

> So perhaps file a blanket JIRA for it or encourage such changes to be tagged [#codehealth] in their subject.

+1. We need to discuss something like this with the community and then add it to the contribution guide.

BTW I mean to say "un-LGTM, we need to see the dep tree to consider impact of this"

Fully agree with @dhalperi that this would benefit from being tagged with the JIRA of whatever endeavor of @peihe is helped by this upgrade.

Thought I'd add some additional flavor since I've perused [their changelog](https://github.com/google/auto/blob/master/value/CHANGES.md). When weighing stability (via dep freeze) versus commonsense keeping up (to get bugfixes and features that haven't bitten us _yet_), I think the Beam community particularly benefits from the following, especially considering our recommendation to use AutoValue in contributed transforms.

> - The classes in the autovalue jar are now shaded with a $ so they never appear in IDE autocompletion.
> - AutoValue now uses its own implementation of a subset of Apache Velocity, so there will no longer be problems with interference between the Velocity that was bundled with AutoValue and other versions that might be present.
> - Explicit check for nested @AutoValue classes being private, or not being static. Otherwise the compiler errors could be hard to understand, especially in IDEs.
> - An Eclipse bug that could occasionally lead to exceptions in the IDE has been fixed (GitHub issue #200)
> - Added logic to AutoValue to detect the confusing case where you think you are using JavaBeans conventions (like getFoo()) but you aren't because at least one method isn't.

So you could reasonably file a JIRA with the title "AutoValue 1.1 -> 1.3 adds bugfixes and features that help us" with those bullets (or more) in the description, just so anyone curious dropping in would find the most interesting details.
R: @aaltay
